    Plot Cells per Spot

    plot_cells_per_spot.Rd

    Plot Cells per Spot

    Usage

    plot_cells_per_spot(
  spatial_obj,
  plot_type = "spatial",
  threshold = 0.01,
  palette = "Mako",
  transform_scale = NULL,
  reverse_palette = FALSE,
  sample_id = "sample01",
  image_id = "lowres",
  show_image = FALSE,
  offset_rotation = FALSE,
  spot_size = 1.17,
  limits = NULL,
  title_size = 30,
  font_size = 20,
  legend_size = 40,
  density = TRUE
)

    Arguments

    spatial_obj

    SpatialExperiment containing deconvolution results

    plot_type

    bar chart or spatial (bar, spatial)

    threshold

    threshold for presence/absence, single value or vector of length nrow(spatial_obj)

    palette

    colorspace palette (sequential)

    transform_scale

    data transform_scaleation to use, "log"

    reverse_palette

    reverse color palette

    sample_id

    sample of SpatialExperiment to be plotted

    image_id

    image of SpatialExperiment for the background annotation

    show_image

    whether to show the histology image in the background

    offset_rotation

    correct hex orientation for rotated visium image

    spot_size

    increase (>1) or decrease (<1) the hex size

    limits

    vector of color scale limit

    title_size

    font size of title

    font_size

    font size of legend

    legend_size

    size of legend in points

    density

    whether to display a density distribution next to the spatial plot

    Value

    A hex plot containing unique cell counts per spot

    Examples

    data("spatial_data_1")
deconv <- spacedeconv::deconvolute(spatial_data_1, method = "estimate")
#> removing 49 spots with zero expression
#> 
#> >>> Running estimate
#> [1] "Merged dataset includes 9969 genes (443 mismatched)."
#> [1] "1 gene set: StromalSignature  overlap= 136"
#> [1] "2 gene set: ImmuneSignature  overlap= 140"
#> attaching token
#> finished deconvolution
#> saving results to object
spacedeconv::plot_cells_per_spot(deconv)
#> Warning: argument is not numeric or logical: returning NA
#> Picking joint bandwidth of 0.693
#> Warning: Removed 2665 rows containing missing values (`geom_vline()`).
